 Pier della Vigna was disgraced  blinded  and imprisoned. Dante's pilgrim finds Pier della Vigna on the seventh level of the Inferno. Like Judas Iscariot  he died by hanging. But Judas and Pier della Vigna are linked in Dante by the avarice he saw in them. In fact avarice and hanging are linked in the medieval mind
 about A.D. 400. It includes the death by hanging of Judas  his face upturned to the branch that suspends him. Here he is again on the doors of the Benevento cathedral  hanging. This time with his bowels falling out
 now in Hell  speak in strained hisses and coughing sibilants as though he is hanging still
